newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ING to reduce U.S. non-life activities.
newsitem.headline: ING to reduce U.S. non-life activities.

text.p: Dutch bank-insurer ING said on Thursday it was planning to wind down its non-life insurance activities in some parts of the United States.
"We are trying to retire from the not-very-attractive states as far as non-life operations are concerned," chairman Aad Jacobs told a news conference.
He said liability insurance in Alabama and non-life insurance in the coastal states near Florida were creating too much uncertainty.
Non-life activities in the coastal states had been hit several times by hurricane damage claims.
These activities account for about eight percent of ING's North-America turnover of about 4.28 billion guilders in the first six months of 1996.
Turnover rose 20 percent, but the non-life result in North-America fell by eight percent to 41 million guilders.
Earlier ING reported a net profit rise for the group of 28 percent in the first six months of 1996 to 1.51 billion guilders compared to 1.18 billion guilders in the same period of 1995.
